import { Props } from 'docz';

import Animation from './components/Animation';
import CameraOptions from './components/CameraOptions';
import FocusOptions from './components/FocusOptions';
import GlobeOptions from './components/GlobeOptions';
import LightOptions from './components/LightOptions';
import Marker from './components/Marker';
import MarkerOptions from './components/MarkerOptions';

# Prop Types

The following provides detailed types and descriptions for `react-globe` props.

## `Marker`

A `Marker` is a Javascript object with required `coordinates` and `size` fields that describe how it should be placed and drawn on the globe. It can contain any other additional fields that are useful for rendering tooltips and handling pointer events.

<Props of={Marker} />

## `EasingFunction`

Easing functions are specified using two array parameters and define animations in `react-globe`. They are based on the following [TweenJS curves](https://sole.github.io/tween.js/examples/03_graphs.html).

- ['Back', 'In']
- ['Back', 'Out']
- ['Back', 'InOut']
- ['Bounce', 'In']
- ['Bounce', 'Out']
- ['Bounce', 'InOut']
- ['Circular', 'In']
- ['Circular', 'Out']
- ['Circular', 'InOut']
- ['Cubic', 'In']
- ['Cubic', 'Out']
- ['Cubic', 'InOut']
- ['Elastic', 'In']
- ['Elastic', 'Out']
- ['Elastic', 'InOut']
- ['Linear', 'None']
- ['Exponential', 'In']
- ['Exponential', 'Out']
- ['Exponential', 'InOut']
- ['Quadratic', 'In']
- ['Quadratic', 'Out']
- ['Quadratic', 'InOut']
- ['Linear', 'None']
- ['Cubic', 'In']
- ['Cubic', 'Out']
- ['Cubic', 'InOut']
- ['Quartic', 'In']
- ['Quartic', 'Out']
- ['Quartic', 'InOut']
- ['Quintic', 'In']
- ['Quintic', 'Out']
- ['Quintic', 'InOut']
- ['Sinusoidal', 'In']
- ['Sinusoidal', 'Out']
- ['Sinusoidal', 'InOut']
- ['Exponential', 'In']
- ['Exponential', 'Out']
- ['Exponential', 'InOut']
- ['Circular', 'In']
- ['Circular', 'Out']
- ['Circular', 'InOut']
- ['Elastic', 'In']
- ['Elastic', 'Out']
- ['Elastic', 'InOut']
- ['Quadratic', 'In']
- ['Quadratic', 'Out']
- ['Quadratic', 'InOut']

## `Animation`

An `Animation` is a Javascript object with four required fields that describe how an animation should behave. When passed in the `animations` prop as an array of `Animation`, `react-globe` will sequentially execute the animation steps.

<Props of={Animation} />

## `CameraOptions`

Use the `CameraOptions` to control the globe camera (i.e. how the globe is viewed). You can pass any number of option fields. Default options can be imported from the module with:

```js
import { defaultCameraOptions } from 'react-globe';
```

<Props of={CameraOptions} />

## `FocusOptions`

Use the `FocusOptions` to control how focused coordinates behave. You can pass any number of option fields. Default options can be imported from the module with:

```js
import { defaultFocusOptions } from 'react-globe';
```

<Props of={FocusOptions} />

## `GlobeOptions`

Use the `GlobeOptions` to control the looks and behaviors of the globe. You can pass any number of option fields. Default options can be imported from the module with:

```js
import { defaultGlobeOptions } from 'react-globe';
```

<Props of={GlobeOptions} />

## `LightOptions`

Use the `LightOptions` to control the color and intensity values of ambient and point lights. The ambient light illuminates all objects in the scene equally while the point light provides a source of light emitting from a single point. You can pass any number of option fields. Default options can be imported from the module with:

```js
import { defaultLightOptions } from 'react-globe';
```

<Props of={LightOptions} />

## `MarkerOptions`

Use the `MarkerOptions` to control the looks and behavior of markers. If you provide a valid marker `type` (e.g. `bar`, `dot`), `react-globe` will render the corresponding supported marker. You can pass any number of option fields. Default options can be imported from the module with:

```js
import { defaultMarkerOptions } from 'react-globe';
```

<Props of={MarkerOptions} />
